thread.title: What to Watch on Monday: Check out ‘What Phil’s Having’
thread.title_full: What to Watch on Monday: Check out ‘What Phil’s Having’

author:
Brooke Cain 
bcain@newsobserver.com
title: What to Watch on Monday: Check out ‘What Phil’s Having’
text:
Order Reprint of this Story 
I’ll Have What Phil’s Having (10 p.m., UNC-TV) – A great new series (it started last week) in which Phil Rosenthal travels the world to experience the delicious foods of various regions. Tonight he’s in Italy, where he gets a home-cooked meal at chef Nancy Silverton’s house in Umbria. If you missed last week’s debut set in Tokyo, track it down ( here’s what I wrote about it last week ). I love this show. 
Gotham (8 p.m., Fox) – Gordon faces off with Jerome, and a magic show at a gala for Gotham Children’s Hospital becomes a hostage situation. 
Life in Pieces (8:30 p.m., CBS) – Matt teaches Colleen how to connect with his family, and Greg has an encounter with cops when he’s overtired. 
Significant Mother (9:30 p.m., CW) – The first season ends with Nate asking Sam and Atticus to help convince Jimmy that he made a mistake. 
Castle (10 p.m., ABC) – Castle poses as a college professor so he can investigate a student’s gruesome murder. Related content
